articles.content: The lazily winding spiral arms of the spectacular galaxy NGC 976 fill the frame of this image from the NASA/ESA Hubble Space Telescope. This spiral galaxy lies around 150 million light-years from the… [+1701 chars]

articles.title: Study finds copper-based chemicals might be leading to ozone layer depletion - ANI News
articles.description: California [US], January 15 (ANI): A new study has found that copper released into the environment from brake pads, antifouling paints, and other sources may be contributing significantly to stratospheric ozone depletion.
articles.content:
ANI | Updated: Jan 15, 2022 14:35 IST
